title: Part A
stimulusHtml:
3 point is earned for solving f′(x) = 0

1 point is deducted for each incorrect point

1 point is deducted for each missing point

horizontal tangent ⇔ f′(x) = 0

x = −7, −1, 4, 8
descriptions:
The student response earns none of the following points:

3 point is earned for solving f′(x) = 0

1 point is deducted for each incorrect point

1 point is deducted for each missing point

horizontal tangent ⇔ f′(x) = 0

x = −7, −1, 4, 8

The student response earns one of the following points:

3 point is earned for solving f′(x) = 0

1 point is deducted for each incorrect point

1 point is deducted for each missing point

horizontal tangent ⇔ f′(x) = 0

x = −7, −1, 4, 8

The student response earns two of the following points:

1 point is deducted for each incorrect point

1 point is deducted for each missing point

horizontal tangent ⇔ f′(x) = 0

x = −7, −1, 4, 8

The student response earns all of the following points:

1 point is deducted for each incorrect point

1 point is deducted for each missing point

title: Part B
stimulusHtml:
2 points are earned for answer

1 point is earned for justification

1 point is deducted for each incorrect or missing point

Relative maxima at x = −1, 8 because f′ changes from positive to negative at these points

title: Part C
stimulusHtml:
1 of 3 points are earned for correct sub intervals

2 of 3 points are earned for 1 correct interval with analysis

3 of 3 points are earned for 2 correct intervals

f concave downward ⇔ f′ decreasing (−3, 2), (6,10)
descriptions:
The student response earns none of the following points:

1 of 3 points are earned for correct sub intervals

2 of 3 points are earned for 1 correct interval with analysis

3 of 3 points are earned for 2 correct intervals

f concave downward ⇔ f′ decreasing (−3, 2), (6,10)
